name: 4.11 "Don Juan is Hell" Quiz | 'Cheers'- Season 4 | 10 Questions

questions.text: What did Woody challenge Carla to?
questions.explanation:
sports knowledge contest.

	Carla knew sports answers to any question she was given. Woody wanted to prove he knew just as much and that Carla couldn't find a question he didn't know the answer too. He proved that Carla couldn't ask him a question which he could not answer.

options: The Life Story of Princess Diana
questions.explanation:
Human Sexuality.

	Diane was taken a class on human sexuality and reading the book for that course. Diane was always enrolled at some class or another. She was a life long learner.

questions.text: Who did Diane do a case study on?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	Since Sam had been with so many women he made the perfect case study for Diane's human sexuality case. He at one point stated "She even made my sex life boring."

questions.text: How many subjects did Diane say she would have a Master's Degree in?
questions.explanation:
37.

	She stated in a previous episode that she had done over 80 majors. Later on in the 200th episode she is described as a pseudo-intellectual which the dictionary defines as a person who wants to appear to have a lot of intelligence but in reality has very little.

questions.text: What name did Diane choose for this case study?
questions.explanation:
Trevor.

	Sam did not like the name that was chosen and said he should get to pick out the name. The name he chose was Duke, but Diane stuck with Trevor.

questions.text: When was Sam's first time having sex?
questions.correct: so young he needed to wait for the crossing guard to help him cross the street.
options: so young he had to have his mom drive him to the girl's house.
questions.explanation:
so young he needed to wait for the crossing guard to help him cross the street.

	He said his second time was the school crossing guard. Sam is known for his sexual promiscuity.

questions.text: How old was Diane the first time she had sex?
questions.explanation:
19.

	She said she met a guy the summer of her 19th year. At first she didn't want to answer when Sam asked her since the case study was about him, but she gave in and told him.

questions.text: When Diane's professor asked Sam if the case study was accurate how did Sam reply?
questions.correct: "We had to change a few names to protect the satisfied."
options: "I just made up some stuff to help Diane out."
questions.explanation:
"We had to change a few names to protect the satisfied."

	Diane's professor was amazed at how much like Don Juan, Sam was. Don Juan was a legendary character known for seducing a lot of women.

No.

	Diane asked him to read it and he said he would. But when asked if he read it he said, "I didn't have to, I lived it." Diane was upset he didn't read it because he saw himself as this great conqueror of women, but Diane's paper made him out to be "a rapidly aging adolescent".

questions.text: What did Cliff send a picture of to a reporter?
questions.correct: a squash with the Hawaiian islands
options: a pineapple that looked like the Alps
a potato that looked like Richard Nixon
questions.explanation:
a squash with the Hawaiian islands.

	The reporter thought that Cliff was a eccentric. Cliff has come up with a few of these produce abnormalities in various episodes. In another episode he did come up with the potato that looked like Richard Nixon.
